result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael Lee Chapman Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Lee Chapman Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lee Chapman Jr

defendant.name: Chapman, Michael Lee, Jr

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Lee Chapman Jr in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael Lee Chapman Jr. 
Also calling 22CF72 and 22tr569,570,571,572.
Defendant waives preliminary hearings. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bail continued
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael Lee Chapman Jr appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Case to transfer to Branch I. Court reminds defendant to follow bond conditions of DEJ in Branch I case. Court sets bond. adj.1:23 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
